meanings.sent1: I will be reinviting my friend to the party since she couldn't make it last time.
meanings.sent2: She decided to reinvite her classmates to the study group after they missed the first session.
meanings.sent3: The cat kept reinviting the mouse to play, but the mouse was too busy.
meanings.sent4: The sun reinviting the flowers to bloom after a long winter.
meanings.sent5: The teacher's warm smile was reinviting to the shy student.

meanings.sent1: After the cancellation, they are reinviting guests to the wedding.
meanings.sent2: The club is reinviting members to join their upcoming event.
meanings.sent3: The magician kept reinviting the audience to witness his amazing tricks.
meanings.sent4: The ocean reinviting the surfers to catch the perfect wave.
meanings.sent5: The museum's new exhibit was reinviting visitors to explore art in a different way.

meanings.definition: The act of inviting someone again.
meanings.sent1: The reinviting of old friends to the reunion brought back fond memories.
meanings.sent2: She received a reinviting to the charity gala after missing the first one.
meanings.sent3: The reinviting of the lost hikers to join the group saved the day.
meanings.sent4: The reinviting of the birds to the feeder delighted the birdwatchers.
meanings.sent5: The reinviting of the team to the championship game boosted their spirits.
